title: PSA: Real SoloQ
body:
With the inclusion of FlexQ, please remove the option for "duo" in the soloQ lineup. It takes away from the purity of the queue. In addition, if we want to play with groups, we have flex.

Thank you.

replies.body:
Yeah agreed. I'll just copy the post I made yesterday:

I really don't see the point of allowing duos in "solo" queue at all. It doesn't really eliminate the problems of DQ, just lessens them. Namely:

1) Legitimate boosting is still allowed, since people can duo with high ranking smurfs and get winrates they wouldn't get by themselves. That includes paid boosting, which is an abomination for any ladder with any semblance of competitive integrity.

2) It doesn't completely level the playing field. Duos still have an unfair advantage over solos since they can practice together, have easier access to voice coms and generally work well together. Specially a support/ADC duo.

3)It makes matchmaking problematic because even though duos can potentially have an advantage, it doesn't necessarily mean they do. If they don't put a handicap on duos they'll have an advantage over the other team if they have things like voice comms or trained together. And on the other hand if they're just random people that happened to queue together but don't really have comms or played before etc, then the team hosting them will be on a disadvantage because the system will handicap the matchmaking accounting for an advantage that isn't really there.

4)Allowing duos in Solo Queue makes the Flex Queue less viable. Duos and trios complement eachother and 5s are self sufficient, so only 4s need solo players. By funneling duos into the flex queue they don't need to worry as much about attracting solo players.

Back when there was only one ladder, it made sense to allow duos into solo queue, because people who wanted to play with a friend would have no other way to do that. But now we have 2 separate ladders and you can be part of both at the same time, so the reason doesn't exist anymore. Just play solo on solo queue and hop over to flex for the games when you want to premade with friends. Everyone wins.
Queue times would definitely be lower for both queues if there was Pure Solo

Oh really? How many pure solo players think they can carry the game on Support? 

A Duo can at least count on one person being a decent carry that they can back up in team fights and what not if they choose to go Support, Solos don't have that luxury. Without Supports the Solo Queue would grind to a halt.

I'm trying to prove that Queue Times for Solo Only Queue *won't* be faster because they'll be even more heavily bottle-necked by a lack of Supports.

Well the problem of a not enough support players is something Riot should address directly, rather than leaving duo queue just because some of them are duo bots where the support would otherwise try to play a carry role.  I don't think the impact on queue times would be that large from switching to pure solo, as a lot of duos are a solo laner and a jungler or other role combinations that don't include a support.

I personally didn't mind dynamic queue, but all the bad things about it are true of duo queue to a lesser extent. Solo players that were abused by 3 or 4 man queues can still be abused by duos, and a solo player playing with 2 duos on his team still has way less impact on a match usually than a solo player playing with 4 other solos.
? I've found it easier than most roles to carry the game as support.

Well, there are support mains out there *raises hand* and there is this thing called auto fill. Yeah, it blows getting auto filled into a role you don't like/aren't good at but back in the day (i.e., before last season) you had to be able to at least try to play any role. Besides, there is a lot to the game that you learn from playing other roles.

If you're getting Auto Filled it's because the queue times would be *longer* than currently. Season 5 and earlier was fast because it didn't have the role preference system, so it didn't have to find a full team before dumping people into a lobby.

Support Mains obviously exist, but they're in high demand and short supply, *particularly* in Solo Queue, where the mantra seems to be "play hard carry champions and 1v9 the game". 

I agree it's good to play every role from time to time. That's why I love going Fill in Blind Pick, it actually gives me a random role to mix things up.
I would upvote you 832793457 times if i could

1. It's nearly impossible to totally eliminate boosting. Like, this honestly shouldn't even be a legitimate point because you can very, _very_ easily pay someone to log into your account for you and boost you. If anything, queing with someone that's a smurf is just a **safer** way to boost for those afraid to have someone log onto their account.

2. Duo's were very, very frequently matched against other duo's, especially in the lower divisions. It is _significantly_ easier for the game to matchmake another team that also has a duo in it to balance the level of skill between the two teams, as opposed to say, attempting to find two three man premades, or 4 or 5.

3. This has very close ties to point 2, so might as well just combine the two into a larger point. Will say that it doesn't make sense to ever be premade with someone you haven't played games with before or at least have comms. And there's no denying the advantage that comms give you, but there are ways to work around that since it's two players on the enemy team that has that advantage. When only two people have voice comms/play history together, it's not as devastating an advantage as if, say, 3 or 4 or all of them have it.

4. If allowing duo's in solo que makes dynamic que less viable, then that's dynamic que's problem to figure out. Riot's little kitten of a game mode can attract it's own playerbase if it's anywhere near as good as Riot claims it is (which, according to Riot, must be pretty good considering they fucked up the integrity of ranked for an entire season and seriously damaged the trust that their community has in them while doing so). Personally, i have absolutely no problem with duo que stealing premade duos from 3 man premade teams.

Actually what you're describing can be (and BTW, is) easily detectable by Riot's automated systems. Accounts with suspect IP changes (such as people playing ranked games in another city etc) are already automatedly flagged for review. There also systems in place that keep track of your average APM ratio and other patterns, and flag accounts that shows suspect variations. Even changing your password then changing it back can cause your account to be flagged. About a year ago Lyte said in a podcast that they managed to clamp down on account boosting so efficiently that by then it was almost statistically negligible. 

And even if that was not the case, how is this an argument? If we can't find a perfect solution does that mean we should implement an improvement? I don't think that makes sense at all.
 
> 2. Duo's were very, very frequently matched against other duo's, especially in the lower divisions. It is _significantly_ easier for the game to matchmake another team that also has a duo in it to balance the level of skill between the two teams, as opposed to say, attempting to find two three man premades, or 4 or 5.

It doesn't make it any more enjoyable to be for instance a solo ADC lanning against a duo botlane. Even if you win the game it won't have been as enjoyable as if you were playing on even grounds, and it feels doublly bad to lose lane because the opponent had an unfair advantage. Statistically it might even out winrates, but it does nothing for your enjoyment of the matches.

> 3. This has very close ties to point 2, so might as well just combine the two into a larger point. Will say that it doesn't make sense to ever be premade with someone you haven't played games with before or at least have comms. And there's no denying the advantage that comms give you, but there are ways to work around that since it's two players on the enemy team that has that advantage. When only two people have voice comms/play history together, it's not as devastating an advantage as if, say, 3 or 4 or all of them have it.

Sometimes you just met somebody who was pleasant and want to play another match with them. Or maybe they don't have comms or can't use them at the time (it's late at night or something). I could go on and on. And it does make a huge advantage in lane, which can be translated into an advantage in-game if you snowball other lanes. Imagine this scenario: you're a midlaner playing an even or slightly advantageous lane so far. Then bot lane loses hard and you're collapsed on by the support and ADC. 

> 4. If allowing duo's in solo que makes dynamic que less viable, then that's dynamic que's problem to figure out. Riot's little kitten of a game mode can attract it's own playerbase if it's anywhere near as good as Riot claims it is (which, according to Riot, must be pretty good considering they fucked up the integrity of ranked for an entire season and seriously damaged the trust that their community has in them while doing so). Personally, i have absolutely no problem with duo que stealing premade duos from 3 man premade teams.
 
You talk about dynamic queue ruining the competitive integrity of ranked in the same post you defend a totally, 100% legitimate way to be boosted? One that can't even be punished and is in fact incentivized? Doesn't make sense to me.

So far all you've talked about was how the problems I mentioned aren't that bad, but I didn't see anything about why should duos queue with solos instead of with the rest of the premades in the first place. If there's nothing good out of queuing with solos then why should they? What justifies putting up with all the problems I mentioned (even if they were as small as you say)?

Duos being with soloq is a fallback plan in case Flex fails.
They don't want to leave players with no way to play ranked games with friends, and also don't want to be forced to change Solo Queue midseason if Flex doesn't get enough players.
The outcry from Solo Queue players would be significant if Duos were added in halfway, "tainting the purity of Solo Queue."

So the fallback plan is to move Flex to Ranked 5's, and have Solo/Duo Queue. Back to what has been tried and is known to players. This provides the least disruption to all players if Riot has to make significant changes to Flex Queue.

I think they are dooming flex queue to failure by splitting duos between it and solo queue.
